Hey Jonathon,

>Concerning your predator and prey stuff, ...
>They just can't tell the difference! :P

Well, our robots could only sense another robot if the other one was 
transmitting IR and this was listening to it. 
In case of 1 leader, multiple followers, we had hoped that the 
followers would learn to stop transmitting any signals, so that all 
of them could just follow the only transmitter. But it was not meant 
to be :).

>Can you elaborate more on your flocking experiments? It sounds 
>interesting. How you rewarded flocking behaviour etc?

We used sigmoid functions to calculate fitnesses. In the flocking 
behaviors, we tried to minimize the area of the minimum-enclosing-
rectangle (MER) of the robots. Whereas, we also tried to maximize the 
distance moved by the center of the MER.

Have you done any similar experiments?

Regards, 
- Umer
